Weird Things That Only Happen in China Jan 3, 2018

I have panicked unnecessarily in all four corners of the globe. – Jon Ronson

He didn’t really like travel, of course. He liked the idea of travel, and the memory of travel, but not travel itself. – Julian Barnes

Modern traveling is not traveling at all; it is merely being sent to a place, and very little different from becoming a parcel. – John Ruskin

The gentle reader will never, never know what a consummate ass he can become until he goes abroad. I speak now, of course, in the supposition that the gentle reader has not been abroad, and therefore is not already a consummate ass. – Mark Twain

In some peculiar way, indeed, the rules were now beginning to seem quite logical.
It was then I knew that I had been in India long enough.
– Tahir Shah

Adventure, yeah. I guess that’s what you call it when everybody comes back alive.
– Mercedes Lackey

Statuettes of drunken sailors, velvet pictures of island maidens,
plastic seashell lamps made in Taiwan.
What contempt the people who think up souvenirs have for other people.
– Diane Johnson

Sometimes the road less traveled is less traveled for a reason. – Jerry Seinfeld

It can hardly be a coincidence that no language on earth has ever produced the expression,
‘As pretty as an airport’. – Douglas Adams

He has a passport,” my classmates would whisper. “Quick, let’s run before he judges us! – David Sedaris

It is the right of a traveler to vent their frustration at every minor inconvenience by writing of it to their friends. – Susanna Clarke

Boy, those French. They have a different word for everything. – Steve Martin

There are two kinds of travel: first class and with children. – Robert Benchley

Airline travel is hours of boredom interrupted by moments of stark terror. – Al Boliska

Airplane travel is nature’s way of making you look like your passport photo. – Al Gore

You define a good flight by negatives: you didn’t get hijacked, you didn’t crash, you didn’t throw up, you weren’t late, you weren’t nauseated by the food. So you are grateful. – Paul Theroux

The worst thing about being a tourist is having other tourists recognize you as a tourist.” –Russell Baker

One senses that, in these conditions, no amount of wet-wiping could bring true hygiene. – Tahir Shah
